title: Stalin takes next step with an open shirt
text:
Stalin takes next step with an open shirt Stalin takes next step with an open shirt Source : Print (Image tweeted by @dhanyarajendran) Chennai : DMK Working President M.K. Stalin on Saturday alleged that he was assaulted in the Tamil Nadu Assembly and said he would meet Tamil Nadu Governor C. Vidyasagar Rao and complain about the happenings in the state assembly. DMK working President MK Stalin alleges that his shirt was torn off when assembly police forcefully evicted his party MLAs. #floortest pic.twitter.com/LYbt0CTFha â ANI (@ANI_news) 18 February 2017 The DMK leader said he sat in protest inside the assembly to press his demand. Stalin alleged he was forcibly evicted by the marshals and his shirt was damaged. Speaking to reporters here after he and his party legislators were evicted from the assembly, Stalin said the party had demanded secret ballot to decide on the motion of confidence moved by Chief Minister Edappadi K. Palaniswami. He said the party demanded adjournment of the house for a week so that legislators can go back to their constituencies and seek the people's views before they come back to vote on the confidence motion. 
After meeting TN Governor and lodging a complaint against the happenings in the assembly, Stalin sat in protest near the Mahatma Gandhi statue on Marina beach against the manner in which he and his party legislators were evicted from the state assembly. 
Protesting DMK MLAs taken into custody 
Police on Saturday took into custody DMK MLAs as they sat on protest, led by party chief Stalin, on Marina beach here against the manner in which the party legislators were evicted from the state assembly. 
Police later took the DMK MLAs into custody. DMK supporters blocked the police vehicles at the venue. 
A couple of hundred metres away at the Marina beach, there were scenes of jubilation by the AIADMK faction led by V.K. Sasikala on Chief Minister Edappadi K. Palaniswami winning the vote of confidence. 
Palaniswami, his ministers and other AIADMK party men arrived at the beach to pay their homage to late Chief Minister J. Jayalalithaa at her memorial in Marina.
